title: Ticket #4010: Get rid of extraneous subsections in version history
description:
Currently our version history has six subsections with each release -
  1. Release Notes
  2. New Features
  3. Configuration Variable and ClassAd Attribute Additions and Changes
  4. Bugs Fixed
  5. Known Bugs
  6. Additions and Changes to the Manual

There is a lot of needless overlap, items gets mis-categorized and therefore not communicated properly, and items 5 and 6 are incorrectly empty 95% of the time.

Things that are "known bugs", i.e. regression bugs that are important enough re this release that folks need to know about them, should go into the Release Notes. Changes to config variables or classad attributes are either new features or bug fixes. Additions or changes to the manual happen all the time; if there is a significant new section it could be listed as a new feature.

Thus I propose the following subsections for each release -

  1. Release Notes
  2. New Features
  3. Bugs Fixed

I don't think we need to go backwards and edit the past, but going forward with each new stable and developer release I would like to see just these three version history sections.
